name: deno
description: A modern JavaScript and TypeScript runtime

options.description: Enable unstable features and APIs
Suppress diagnostic output
Print help (see a summary with '-h')
Print version

subcommands.name: run
subcommands.description: Run a JavaScript or TypeScript program

options.description: Skip type-checking. If the value of '--no-check=remote' is supplied, diagnostic errors from remote modules will be ignored.
Enable unstable features and APIs

Load import map file from local file or remote URL. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/linking_to_external_code/import_maps Specification: https://wicg.github.io/import-maps/ Examples: https://github.com/WICG/import-maps#the-import-map
Do not resolve remote modules
Suppress diagnostic output
Do not resolve npm modules
Enables or disables the use of a local node_modules folder for npm packages

The configuration file can be used to configure different aspects of deno including TypeScript, linting, and code formatting. Typically the configuration file will be called `deno.json` or `deno.jsonc` and automatically detected; in that case this flag is not necessary. See https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/getting_started/configuration_file
Disable automatic loading of the configuration file.
Reload source code cache (recompile TypeScript) --reload
Check the specified lock file.
Force overwriting the lock file.
Disable auto discovery of the lock file.
Load certificate authority from PEM encoded file
Allow file system read access. Optionally specify allowed paths. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
Allow file system write access. Optionally specify allowed paths. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
Allow network access. Optionally specify allowed IP addresses and host names, with ports as necessary. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
DANGER: Disables verification of TLS certificates
Allow access to system environment information. Optionally specify accessible environment variables. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
Allow access to OS information. Optionally allow specific APIs by function name. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
Allow running subprocesses. Optionally specify allowed runnable program names. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
(Unstable) Allow loading dynamic libraries. Optionally specify allowed directories or files. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions Examples:
Allow high-resolution time measurement. Note: this can enable timing attacks and fingerprinting. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions
Allow all permissions. Learn more about permissions in Deno: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions
Always throw if required permission wasn't passed
Activate inspector on host:port (default: 127.0.0.1:9229)
Activate inspector on host:port, wait for debugger to connect and break at the start of user script
Activate inspector on host:port and wait for debugger to connect before running user code
Require that remote dependencies are already cached
Value of 'globalThis.location' used by some web APIs
To see a list of all available flags use --v8-flags=--help.
Set the random number generator seed
Enable type-checking. This subcommand does not type-check by default. If the value of '--check=all' is supplied, diagnostic errors from remote modules will be included.

Watch for file changes and restart process automatically. Local files from entry point module graph are watched by default. Additional paths might be watched by passing them as arguments to this flag.
Do not clear terminal screen when under watch mode
Set content type of the supplied file
Print help (see a summary with '-h')

Allow all permissions. Learn more about permissions in Deno: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/basics/permissions
Always throw if required permission wasn't passed
Activate inspector on host:port (default: 127.0.0.1:9229)
Activate inspector on host:port, wait for debugger to connect and break at the start of user script
Activate inspector on host:port and wait for debugger to connect before running user code

To see a list of all available flags use --v8-flags=--help.
Set the random number generator seed

Set type-checking behavior. This subcommand type-checks local modules by default, so adding --check is redundant. If the value of '--check=all' is supplied, diagnostic errors from remote modules will be included.
Ignore files
Cache test modules, but don't run tests
Enable tracing of async ops. Useful when debugging leaking ops in test, but impacts test execution time.

Stop after N errors. Defaults to stopping after first failure.
Don't return error code if no test files are found

Shuffle the order in which the tests are run
Collect coverage profile data into DIR
Run test modules in parallel. Parallelism defaults to the number of available CPUs or the value in the DENO_JOBS environment variable.
Watch for file changes and restart process automatically.
Do not clear terminal screen when under watch mode

options.description: The directory to output the vendored modules to
Enable unstable features and APIs
Forcefully overwrite conflicting files in existing output directory

The configuration file can be used to configure different aspects of deno including TypeScript, linting, and code formatting. Typically the configuration file will be called `deno.json` or `deno.jsonc` and automatically detected; in that case this flag is not necessary. See https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/getting_started/configuration_file

Load import map file from local file or remote URL. Docs: https://deno.land/manual@v1.35.3/linking_to_external_code/import_maps Specification: https://wicg.github.io/import-maps/ Examples: https://github.com/WICG/import-maps#the-import-map
Check the specified lock file.
Enables or disables the use of a local node_modules folder for npm packages
Reload source code cache (recompile TypeScript) --reload
Load certificate authority from PEM encoded file

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

tldr:
> A secure runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript.
> More information: <https://deno.land>.

- Run a JavaScript or TypeScript file:

`deno run {{path/to/file.ts}}`

- Start a REPL (interactive shell):

`deno`

- Run a file with network access enabled:

`deno run --allow-net {{path/to/file.ts}}`

- Run a file from a URL:

`deno run {{https://deno.land/std/examples/welcome.ts}}`

- Install an executable script from a URL:

`deno install {{https://deno.land/std/examples/colors.ts}}`
